race_name: Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out

top_categories.workout_context: 83ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out's Olympic Peninsula, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out. Train it until it feels boring.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 5,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 60 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
60 miles on olympic Peninsula gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on olympic peninsula gravel to build confidence. Expect: olympic peninsula, mountain gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 60 miles of olympic peninsula gravel in Quilcene, WA.
